item.title: FormatEnumerationLimit
item.description: Sometimes there is output from a cmdlet that gets truncated on the screen, even though there is more space to fill in the console window. To not truncate the output of your PowerShell commands set the variable $FormatEnumerationLimit to -1 $FormatEnumerationLimit=-1 Now the output from cmdlets will fill the console window. So what is the $FormatEnumerationLimit variable? Here is the definition from the about_preferences doc: $FormatEnumerationLimit Determines how many enumerated items are included in a display.
